newsitem.title: UK: S&P says affirms ratings on Sanwa Bank.
newsitem.headline: S&P says affirms ratings on Sanwa Bank.

text.p: Standard & Poor's said on Tuesday it had affirmed its A/A1 ratings on Sanwa Bank Ltd following the bank's announcement its performance in fiscal 1996 would be negatively affected by increased loss provisions and the decline in stock prices.

"An increase in loss provisions had already been factored into the rating, while Sanwa is expected to partially offset devaluation losses on its equity portfolio by converting unrealised gains," S&P said in a statement.

It added its outlook for the bank was negative, reflecting S&P's continuing concerns about the asset quality problems of Japanese banks, including the impact of depressed collateral values on the amount of future losses.
